definition: lit. to allay one's hunger using a picture of a cake/to feed on illusions (idiom)
to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]
to fill/to satisfy/to fulfill/to act in place of/substitute/sufficient/full

sentences.english: He giggled/chuckled and said, “This is called ‘ drawing a cake to satisfy one’s hunger’.”
sentences.chinese: 他咯咯的笑着說，“這叫做畫餅充飢”。

sentences.english: Can look at the family's website only, him feed on illusions.
sentences.chinese: 只能看着人家的網站，自己畫餅充飢。

sentences.english: The idiom came from what the emperor said.
sentences.chinese: 成語“畫餅充飢”就來自於皇帝所說的話。
